intro: Claytonia calycina, commonly known as the "peppergrass," is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in early spring. Claytonia calycina is also known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments, making it a versatile addition to woodland gardens.
